content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md)
    code = ""
    doc = parse(md)
    for (i, block) in enumerate(doc.content)
        if isa(block, Markdown.Code) && block.lang == "julia"
            code_snippet = replace(block.code, r"^```julia\n|\n```$" => "")
            code = i > 1 ? code * "\n" * code_snippet : code_snippet
        end
    end
    return code
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package to parse the provided markdown document. It then iterates through the blocks of the document, checking if they are code blocks that contain Julia code. If they are, it removes the code fences and appends the code to the `code` string, adding a newline character in between blocks if necessary. The function then returns the `code` string.
